summary: The “Keeping Obstetrics Local Act” aims to improve maternal healthcare access. Key provisions include enhanced financial support for rural and safety net hospitals offering obstetric services, requiring adequate Medicaid payment rates for these services, and expanding maternal health coverage under Medicaid and CHIP. The bill also focuses on health homes for pregnant and postpartum women, support for maternal health professionals, and the collection and public communication of data related to obstetric services, including hospital closures.
